title: New publication on BEXIS2 as a FAIR-aligned research data management system
author: Roman Gerlach
content:
Can BEXIS2 support you in making your research data compatible with Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable (FAIR) data principles?

The new publication BEXIS2: A FAIR-aligned data management system for biodiversity, ecology, and environmental data by Chamanara et al. demonstrates how are the FAIR data principles integrated into the BEXIS2 application.

The paper also presents community deployment examples of the BEXIS2 instances to explain its capacity to meet the data management needs of differently sized projects and serve as an organizational research data management system.

The authors of the paper are grateful to the developers who contributed to the development of the BEXIS2 over the years; the current and previous data managers and curators for providing the feedback to improve the usability of the BEXIS2 system; Thüringer Universitäts und Landesbibliothek Jena for providing the Open Access Publication Fund.

Citation:

Chamanara J, Gaikwad J, Gerlach R, Algergawy A, Ostrowski A, König-Ries B (2021) BEXIS2: A FAIR-aligned data management system for biodiversity, ecology and environmental data. Biodiversity Data Journal 9: e72901. https://doi.org/10.3897/BDJ.9.e72901

title: BEXIS2 Release - 2.14.5
author: David Schöne
content:
Before you rush off into the weekend, wait a minute. Here’s some great news. We have released a small but nice new patch.

Yes, BEXIS2 2.14.5 is now available.

Attention: Changes were made in the web.config in line: 72 (see #803)

Look forward to Monday and have fun with BEXIS2 stay healthy.

BEXIS2.14.5 is now available >>> here <<<

title: BEXIS2 Release - 2.14.4
author: Sven Thiel
content:
From the home office, we send greetings and wish you good health. To make the challenging time a little more bearable, we send, besides the greetings also a patch for BEXIS2 that you should not miss.

Attention! Changes have been made in SMTP credentials and web.config. If an update is made, please use the new files and adapt them.

BEXIS2.14.4 is now available on our GitHub page: here.

title: BEXIS2 Release - 2.14.6

content: BEXIS2.14.6 is now available on our github page: here.

title: BEXIS2 Release - 2.15
author: David Schöne
content:
Even though the sun is shining outside, we have continued to work. :D So we can release the new version earlier than expected.

BEXIS2.15 is now available on our github page: here.

title: BEXIS2: a system for FAIR and reproducible research data management workshop at the FORSCHUNGSDATEN@RMU 2022
author: Jitendra Gaikwad
content:
During the workshop, we demonstrated the working of the BEXIS2 and provided hands-on experience of using BEXIS2 as to potential data managers or system administrators. The workshop was attended by 19 participants.

The program is available here

title: NFDI ToolTalk: BEXIS2 Research Data Management System
author: Jitendra Gaikwad
content:
As part of the NFDI INFRA Talk series, Roman Gerlach gave a talk on BEXIS2 Research Data Management System.

The talk is now available on the NFDI YouTube Channel >>> here<<<

title: BEXIS2 Release - 3.2.0
author: David Schöne
content:
This release focused on updating UI libraries, fixing bugs, adding new constraint features, and adding the first version of the new primary data for testing.

Please take a look at here for more details.

title: BEXIS2 Release - 3.2.1
author: David Schöne
content:

Please take a look at here for more details.

title: BEXIS2 Release - 3.3.0
author: Franziska Zander
content:
It took us a bit longer, but BEXIS2 version 3.3.0 also has exciting new features! The first is the Darwin Core Archive Export, which is now possible entirely via the UI of BEXIS2 (metadata & data). The second bigger feature is the integration of a DOI workflow, which allows issuing DOIs at DataCite (your institutional account is required). Further, BEXIS2 instance can now define their own landing page and use an external metadata form to enter metadata. As part of our new release procedure we updated libraries, but also improved authentication options needed for our future development and fixed several bugs.

Please take a look at here for more details.
